IMPORTANT . No. 1495 • Your telegram No. 82 dated 1st September. Charter flights by Ethiopian Air Line* No objection in principle to these flights but please arrange in conjunction with A.H.Q. Aden in view of your telegram No. 84. 2 # i presume you will comraunicate with Government of India. Your telegram No. 82 appears not (repeat not) to have been repeated to them. Copy to:- Colonial Office - Mr. R.J. Vile* M.C.A. - Mr. Braidman (A.S.G.(l)). Air Ministry, Whitehall - Wing Commander Cox (S.o.J » ' - Registry Telegrams (4)* Foreign Office - Mr. James Murray. C.R.O. (B) - Mr. Harrison.Inward Telegram to Commonwealth Relations Office ALLOTTED TO FINANCE & ECONOMIC DEIV-RTUEIIT » g y/YORD Q ODE * FROM : CHIEF SECRETARY ADEE. RPTD, TO : P/^ISTAIT (GOVT.) ( No. 68 ) POLITICAL ^GENT MUSCAT ( No. 8 ) D, i'.DEN 12.45 Moure ? 1st Soptumber, 194G» R* 14.10 hours 9 1st ' ' Mo. 82 . Ethiopian Lino propose scries 62 charter fli ;hts het./een period September 15th and October 5th between Bombay and Aden. Number depends on availability of fuel at Masira. Aircraft will be D.0.3 Dakotas and call sipn E.T.T., crew as on previous charter flights. Route will be Aden, Masira, Karachi, Bombay and return. Grateful for permission to make these fli pits, and for usual facilities en route. Copy to:- . Colonial Office - Mr. R.J* Vile. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file. File notes can be found at the back of the file on folio 5. Serial numbers in red ink, which occur throughout the file, refer to entries in the notes.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of two telegrams (from the Government of Pakistan) respecting a proposed charter flight from Bombay to Aden by Ethiopian Air Lines, and a single telegram (from the Government of India) regarding the cancellation of a proposed charter flight by Indian Overseas Airlines.
